definitions.text: an open or empty space in or between things
examples: there was a small opening between the trees
the explosion made a gap in the wall

definitions.text: a ceremony accompanying the start of some enterprise
becoming open or being made open
examples: the opening of his arms was the sign I was waiting for

definitions.text: the first performance (as of a theatrical production)
examples: the opening received good critical reviews

definitions.text: the act of opening something
examples: the ray of light revealed his cautious opening of the door

definitions.text: opportunity especially for employment or promotion
examples: there is an opening in the sales department

definitions.text: the initial part of the introduction
examples: the opening established the basic theme

definitions.text: a possible alternative
examples: bankruptcy is always a possibility

definitions.text: an aperture or hole that opens into a bodily cavity
examples: the orifice into the aorta from the lower left chamber of the heart

definitions.text: a vacant or unobstructed space that is man-made
examples: they left a small opening for the cat at the bottom of the door

definitions.text: an entrance equipped with a hatch; especially a passageway between decks of a ship
a recognized sequence of moves at the beginning of a game of chess
examples: he memorized all the important chess openings

definitions.text: the first of a series of actions
cause to open or to become open
examples: Mary opened the car door

definitions.text: start to operate or function or cause to start operating or functioning
examples: open a business

definitions.text: become open
examples: The door opened

definitions.text: begin or set in action, of meetings, speeches, recitals, etc.
examples: He opened the meeting with a long speech

definitions.text: spread out or open from a closed or folded state
examples: open the map
spread your arms

definitions.text: make available
examples: This opens up new possibilities

definitions.text: become available
examples: an opportunity opened up

definitions.text: have an opening or passage or outlet
examples: The bedrooms open into the hall

definitions.text: make the opening move
examples: Kasparov opened with a standard opening

definitions.text: afford access to
examples: the door opens to the patio
The French doors give onto a terrace

definitions.text: display the contents of a file or start an application as on a computer
first or beginning
examples: the memorable opening bars of Beethoven's Fifth
the play's opening scene
